Package edu.missouri.geom

Class PolygonFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mmkrusniak.geom.PolygonFactory
  • public class PolygonFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    PolygonFactory creates some useful polygons which define regions with important characteristics for coverage problems. There is also legacy code for importing polygons from other sources, though I do not recommend using that. We define a hierarchy of eight types of regions, the first five of which are implemented here: (1) Simple shapes with 90 degree angles that can be traversed perfectly. (2) Convex shapes of fair size. (3) Very thin convex shapes, such as sliver triangles. (4) Concave areas that are nevertheless convex in the direction of their width. (5) Concave areas that are convex in at least one direction. (6) Concave areas that are convex in no direction. (7) Rings with removed interiors. (Not representable in this simulation.) (8) Multiple discrete areas (Not representable in this simulation.) For visual examples see https://drive.google.com/file/d/1d56iVcuQBUGQCgW4B1Bh0AJyxrqof_1k/view?usp=sharing.

    • Method Detail

      • type1

        public static Polygon type1​(double minWidth,
                            double maxWidth)
        Generates a "Type 1" polygon within the requested parameters.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - Minimum width of the area.
        maxWidth - Maximum width of the area.
        Returns:
        A random rectangle that fits those parameters.

      • type2

        public static Polygon type2​(double minWidth,
                            int n)
        Generate a random "Type 2" polygon, a convex polygon with the guarantee that it is not too thin.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - Minimum width of the polygon.
        n - Number of sides of the polygon.
        Returns:
        A random "Type 2" polygon

      • type3

        public static Polygon type3​(double maxSize,
                            int n,
                            double thinness)
        Generates a random "Type 3" polygon, a convex polygon that may be very thin.
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum polygonal width of the polygon.
        n - The number of sides of the polygon.
        thinness - A float corresponding to how thin and stretched out the polgon should be.
        Returns:
        A random "Type 3" polygon.

      • type4

        public static Polygon type4​(double maxSize,
                            int n)
        Generates a random "Type 4" polygon, which is never concave in the direction of its base. (That is, a polygon which is "simply traversable".)
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum polygonal width of the polygon.
        n - The number of sides of the polygon
        Returns:
        A random "Type 4" polygon.

      • type5

        public static Polygon type5​(double maxSize,
                            int n)
        Generates a random "Type 5" polygon, which is never simply traversable (that is, it is always concave in the direction of its width.)
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum polygonal width of the polygon.
        n - The number of sides of the polygon.
        Returns:
        A random "Type 5" polygon.
